materials.name: Instructor Information
materials.description: Professor: Tedd Wong, E-mail Address: twong76@mtsac.edu, Office Phone: 909-274-4425, Office Location: 61-2505, Office Hours: 6:30 pm MW before class and 8:25 MW after class.

materials.name: Course Details
materials.description: Units: 3; CSU/UC transferrable; Letter Grade Only. Duration: August 26 - Dec 15 (16 weeks including finals). Course Web Site: Canvas (http://inside.mtsac.edu). PRE-REQUISITES: PHYS 4A and MATH 181 (Calc 2).

materials.name: Course Description
materials.description: Vector approach to static equilibrium of rigid bodies, forces, couples in two and three- dimensional space. Application of equilibrium principles to trusses, frames, and machines. Calculation of center-of-mass and centroid. Friction, moment of inertia, distributed and concentrated loads. Forces in cables and beams. Fluid statics. Introduction to virtual work.

materials.name: Required Materials
materials.description: Textbook: Engineering Mechanics: Statics, by R.C. Hibbeler, 15th ed. Other materials: Standard note-taking supplies, a scientific calculator that is NCEES/SAT/ACT approved (e.g., TI-36, TI-84), a straight-edge. Quad rule pad (graph paper) is highly recommended.

materials.name: Grading Scale
materials.description: Homework: 10%, Midterm 1: 15%, Midterm 2: 15%, Midterm 3: 15%, Project: 20%, Final: 25%. Grade Scale: 90-100=A, 80-89=B, 70-79=C, 60-69=D, 59<=F.

materials.name: Important Dates
materials.description: Refund Deadline: 06-Sep-2024; Last Day to Drop Without a 'W': 8-Sep-2024; Last Day to Drop With a 'W': 01-Nov-2024; Last Day to Drop for No-Show: 06-Sep-2024; Last Day to add class: 06-Sep-2024.

materials.name: Lecture L1
materials.description: Chapter 1: General Principles.

materials.name: Lecture L2
materials.description: Chapters 2.1-2.4: Scalars and Vectors, Vector Operations, Vector Addition of Forces, Addition of Coplanar Forces.

materials.name: Lecture L3
materials.description: Chapters 2.5-2.9: Cartesian Vectors, Addition of Cartesian Vectors, Position Vectors, Line Force Vectors, Dot Product.

materials.name: Holiday
materials.description: Holiday this week.

materials.name: Lecture L4 & L5
materials.description: Chapters 3.1-3.4: Equilibrium of Particle, FBD of Particle, Coplanar Forces, 3-D Force.

materials.name: Midterm Review
materials.description: Review session for Midterm #1.

materials.name: Lecture L7 & L8
materials.description: Chapters 4.1-4.5: Scalar Moments, Principle of Moments, Cross Product, Vector Moments About a Point-3D, Vector Moments About an Axis-3D.

materials.name: Lecture L9
materials.description: Chapters 4.6-4.7: Moment of a Couple, Simplify Force and Couple - Force and Moment.

materials.name: Lecture L10, L11, L12
materials.description: Chapters 4.8-5.7: Distributed Loading, Equilibrium of Rigid Body, FBD, Equations of Equilibrium, 2 and 3 Force Members, Constraints and Determinacy.

materials.name: Midterm Review
materials.description: Review session for Midterm #2.

materials.name: Lecture L13
materials.description: Chapters 6.1-6.3: Trusses, Method of Joints (MOJ), Zero Force Members.

materials.name: Lecture L14, L15, L16
materials.description: Chapters 6.4 & 6.6: Method of Sections (MOS), Frames and Machines.

materials.name: Midterm Review and Project Introduction
materials.description: Review for Midterm #3 and introduction of the group project.

materials.name: Lecture L17a & L17b
materials.description: Chapters 7.1-7.3: Internal Loadings, Shear and Moment Diagrams, Distributed Loading.

materials.name: Lecture L18 & L19
materials.description: Chapters 8.1-8.5: Dry Friction, Wedges, Screws, Belts.

materials.name: Project Build & Demo
materials.description: Time dedicated to building and demonstrating group projects.

materials.name: Lecture L20 & L21
materials.description: Chapters 9.1-9.2 & 10.1-10.2: CG, CM, and Centroids, Composite Bodies, Moment of Inertia, Parallel-Axis Theorem.

assignments.name: Final Exam
assignments.description: Final Exam takes place on Monday, December 9th from 7:30 pm to 10:00 pm in room 61-2311.

assignments.name: Group Project
assignments.description: Final submission for the group project.

materials.name: Final Lecture
materials.description: Chapter 10.4: Moment of Inertia for Composite Areas.
